_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Class 1 Div. 1 electric w/in 5 ft. of all transfer (truck loading rail offloading) points w/Class 1 Div. 2 from 5-15 feet, Class 1 Div. 2 w/in 15 ft. of remainder
_prev_prog_3.Description: This facility provides for the transfer of liquefied butane (normal, iso, and mixed), propane, propylene, and  propane ? propylene mix. (hereafter referred to as LPG) under pressure from stationary (detached from locomotive) pressure tank/rail cars (maximum inventory of ten [10] units, at approximately 31,000 gallons of LPG per unit [33,600 gallons of water capacity]. The LPG is transferred to storage vessels consisting of three (3) 60,000 gallon LPG storage cylinders and two (2) 30,000 LPG storage cylinders via four[4] transloading towers. In addition, liquid transfers can occur directly from the railcars via one (1) of five [5] total transloading towers to transport vehicles without prior transfer to a storage cylinder.  The stored liquefied gases are loaded to transport vehicles from the storage cylinders via four (4) loading stations. Liquid transfer is also available via three (3) unloading stations for transport vehicles to offload primarily in the case of over loading.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary:  Inergy Propane LLC dba Inergy Services - South Jersey Terminal was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2004 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes. It is the intent of South Jersey Terminal to incorporate the most recent construction and procedural guidance (NFPA #58-2011) into this process as feasible. If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify Upper Deerfield Township Fire Department as well as the Upper Deerfield Twp. Office of Emergency Management/Cumberland County Department of Public Safety.  Medical emergencies will require notification of the local Emergency Management Services (Upper  Deerfield Township EMS) and Bridgeton Health Center. The closest Level I Trauma Center is Cooper University Hospital in Camden.



Inergy Propane LLC dba Inergy Services - South Jersey Terminal LPG Transloading System and Ancillary Storage Facility provides for the transfer of liquefied butane (normal, iso, and mixed), propane, propylene, and  propane - propylene mix. (hereafter referred to as LPG) under pressure from stationary (detached from locomotive) pressure tank/rail cars (maximum inventory of ten [10] units, at approximately 31,000 gallons of LPG per unit [33,600 gallons of water capacity]. The LPG is transferred to storage vessels consisting of three (3) 60,000 gallon LPG storage cylinders and two (2) 30,000 LPG storage cylinders via four[4] transloading towers. In addition, liquid transfers can occur directly from the railcars via one (1) of five [5] total transloading towers to transport vehicles without prior transfer to a storage cylinder.  The stored liquefied gases are loaded to transport vehicles from the storage cylinders via four (4) loading stations. Liquid transfer is also available via three (3) unloading stations for transport vehicles to offload primarily

in the case of over loading.



The facility's worst case scenario is the failure of a 60,000 gallon butane storage vessel when filled to the greatest amount allowed (85% Maximum LPG Capacity due to system design limitations) resulting in a vapor cloud explosion.  The facility's alternate (potential off-site impact) release scenario is a "BLEVE" accident and associated fireball.



Inergy Propane LLC dba Inergy Services - South Jersey Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40CFR Part 68 Subpart D), New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection (NJDEP) Toxic Catastrophe Prevention Act program N.J.A.C. 7:31 (1-6) and the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard and associated 14 elements (29CR Part 1910.119) and all other applicable state and local laws and regulations. The Transloading System and Ancillary Storage Facility was designed and constructed in accordance with NFPA-58 (2004 Edition).



This existing Transloading System and Ancillary Storage Facility (initiated in 2005) has never had an accident/incident since the onset of operations which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



Process safety controls include excess flow valves, low-melting point feeds to pneumatic valves (fail closed), railcar pressure reliefs, line pressure reliefs, and grounding/interlock (truck) devices. Additional vessel protection includes remote fire monitors. Access to the Facility is restricted to authorized employees, management personnel, and authorized contractors/visitors.



Inergy Propane LLC dba Inergy Services - South Jersey Terminal looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements and will continue coordination to integrate procedures for the LPG Transloading System  and  Ancillary Storage facility.  Additionally, the Bridgeton Facility intends to facilitate further intera
ction and training with the local and county emergency responders including participation in facility response exercises.
